title: Registered Nurse Interview

Interview Descriptions: Standard process and interview. They offer referral bonuses and make the application process easy. It is a small hospital and you probably will get screened by HR then interviewed by the CNO.
Interview Questions: Describe your clinical skills and experience.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at PAM Health (Austin, TX)
Interview Descriptions: easy process. standard questions that are expected in this role. Tell me about a time when... Tell me what you would do it this XX happened, etc. What would you do if XX happened, how would you respond
Interview Questions: situational questions that a nurse encounters

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at PAM Health

Interview Questions: What are your goals and this field.

title: Occupational Therapist Interview

Interview Descriptions: Upon arrival, I was provided with a tour of the facility. Then, I interviewed with the therapy manager, discussing reason for wanting the job, strengths, experience, and salary. It was a quick and pleasant interview.

title: Clinical Navigator Interview

Interview Descriptions: Applied online, was called for interview for next day. Met with CEO and Director. They wanted to move forward and said I just needed to interview with Corporate. The next day, i had video call with Corporate. Then was called that i needed another interview with VP. She was three hours late calling me back and i was driving conducted interview (unprofessional) I was ghosted no call back, no reply to emails and was told they would contact me in a few days. The Corporate team were not genuine . When i asked the VP questions she gave me terrible responses, like she was trying to scare me off, well it worked. Never heard back from them any way. They should state the exact qualifications they are looking for and not waste candidates' time.

title: Director of Organizational Effectiveness and Team Performance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at PAM Health (Penn, PA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Was contacted by Talent Acquisition. Was told that my application was specifically (the only) one selected by the hiring manager...she told me I should be excited when I sounded shocked. The interview was first issued by the hiring manager. The interview went well until she told me that I was competing against someone else that was really good and it would be a difficult decision, and to come back the following week. When returning, I had a "staggered" interview by some of the leadership team...not all at once, but one at a time. Everyone went explicitly into what THEY did, no real questions for me pertaining to my skill set, with the exception of one person who asked me what my first 90 days would look like as well as how I would design out a training. After speaking to them all, I was a bit foggy on what exactly the job would entail, besides maybe a glorified trainer... not "organizational effectiveness" type of duties were heard, but told that would be the vision eventually. 
The owner of the company was great and actually ASKED ME about my Ph.D. which was a "preferred" requirement for the position. The hiring manager did not ask me, but I voluntarily told her.
I spent over 2 hours during the 2nd interview process. Everyone gave me their cards (not sure why). When completed, the hiring manager came in with both thumbs up and seemed very excited.. told me I kept everyone engaged and everyone liked me.  She AGAIN said... it would be a difficult decision (which to me, is a way of saying you're not the one), and then proceeded to say.. well I am blessed to have two great people interview so I can't lose. Very odd. I left with uncertainty and not very excited about the position due to the feeling of wasted time and energy with the decision already really being made. The company seemed like a great place to be, but the odd feeling was a bit contradictory to the excitement of the thumbs up and then the.." well the other person is realllly good and on point etc."  Very inappropriate to compare how awesome (or not) other candidates are with your interviewee.  The position also posted as needing an e-learning development piece, which was never asked of me in terms of my experience. I did send a sample of what I designed ahead of time, but was just told they don't even have the software to do it... yet.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your consulting experience The position posted as needing e-learning development... not asked about my experience with it, just that they don't have the software yet.

title: Physical Therapist Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at PAM Health (Kyle, TX) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions:
For me: First there is a brief phone interview that consisted basically of general info about the position and verbally verifying the info you've supplied in your resume/on-line application. you're also given a chance to ask any questions about them or the position you may have - about 10 days out from the time I applied. If you're still interested, they then forward your application & resume to the specific facility you're applying to. 

Once they receive it, they then call you in for a face to face interview - about another week or so. I was interviewed by the department manager of therapy. She was very cordial and informative and I didn't feel nervous or apprehensive during our chat. She asked the usual questions and was very informative of what was expected and how things ran there. She accepted me right after we were finished talking. 

HR then contacts you via email, sending you their hiring paperwork (about 10 pages) that you could either scan and email back or drop off in person - about 2 - 3 business days after interview. Once they receive that, it took another 4 business days to clear background check and references but they mentioned that it could last up to 10 days after. Once that was cleared, you get informed to come in to sign certain hiring paperwork, supply certain medical records and certs, and go through a health screen (more signing of paper work). Then they set you up for the next orientation date coming up (twice a month), which is considered your first working day.
Interview Questions: The usual: what are your best skills, how would you handle a difficult situation, what types of diagnosis were you most familiar with, how well you work with others/on your own, questions on your work experience and how it pertains to their setting.
